Duplicate code below. It could be rewritten with something like:

 if (contact.surface.mu3 > 0)
 {
    if (contact.surface.use_patch_radius && 
            contact.surface.patch_radius > 0) ||
       (!contact.surface.use_patch_radius && 
            contact.surface.surface_radius > 0)
      {
        contact.surface.mode |= dContactMu3;
        if (contact.surface.slip3 > 0)
        {
          contact.surface.mode |= dContactSlip3;
        }
      }
 }

content.html: @nkoenig

content.raw:
Thanks for the extra checks, the DepthTest wasn't always being run.

I merged in your branch and added a couple of checks f57f94b. It still fails at times, especially when running all tests in a row. More specifically, the second `ASSERT_EQ(this->contactsMsg.contact().size(), 20);` fails sometimes, which means the message is changing before we check all the values.
content.html:
Thanks for the extra checks, the DepthTest wasn't always being run.

content.raw:
I finally looked through the test that you added; it's really nice! I just have some minor suggestions for it (in d3c9e84e408d):

* I added a few debug messages in the loops, so that any failed expectations can be associated with a specific model
* I also added some checks to the Depth test to verify that contacts were checked for each model
content.html:
I finally looked through the test that you added; it's really nice! I just have some minor suggestions for it (in d3c9e84e408d):

  • I also added some checks to the Depth test to verify that contacts were checked for each model
